element.name: Apothecary
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Craft and Creation

description.p: You were a mixer of potions, a master of the subtle art of producing potent magical effects from the right distillations. Hailing from the largest cities or the smallest villages, an apothecary’s work is always in demand, though many that would demand it do not fully appreciate the care that goes into making a potion safe and effective.

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: Alchemist's supplies, herbalism kit
Equipment: A potion of healing, a set of alchemist's supplies, an herbalism kit, and a set of common clothes

setters.set: Medicine, Nature, Alchemist's, and Herbalism kit

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Practice. I work to become the greatest at my craft. (Neutral)
Discovery. Every combination of reagents deserves to be tried. (Chaotic)
Communication. I make sure my patients know exactly what they are about to consume. (Lawful)
Fairness. Those divine folks only treat their followers, everyone deserves my services. (Good)
Greed. Never cure a disease, it’s more profitable to treat the symptoms. (Evil)
Precision. There’s a tonic for any ailment. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: A book of passed down recipes was lost or destroyed, I aim to recreate it.
A magical malady still plagues my hometown, I adventure in hopes of a cure.
I recite or make up rhymes to remember alchemical properties.
I was unable to cure a sick child, I will not fail anyone like that again.
I come from a long line of apothecaries and my surname has renown or infamy.
I have a different scented incense for every occasion and mood.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: You diagnose the illnesses in those around you... whether they have any or not.
You are always on the hunt for the newest alternative medicine remedies.
The best way to know if something is poisonous is to put it in your mouth, builds strong immune systems.
You don’t trust these “divine” powers in the sky and their healing powers with no in basis proper herblore.
An apothecary is paid for their services.
Toxins in the blood can be removed by removing the blood. Leeches work well, but in a pinch...

element.name: Feature: Herblore
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Craft and Creation

description.p: You know what the potions people drink are actually made of. Whenever traveling at half speed or less through wilderness or camping in wilderness, you can acquire 15 gp a day worth of potion reagents that can be used as ingredients for the next potion you craft.

sheet.description: You know what the potions people drink are actually made of. Whenever traveling at half speed or less through wilderness or camping in wilderness, you can acquire 15 gp a day worth of potion reagents that can be used as ingredients for the next potion you craft.

element.name: Engineer
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Craft and Creation

description.p: Scholars and academics are great, but many a kingdom has needed those of the more intellectual bent to put their ability to more practical uses: designing everything from siege equipment to bridges.
While construction may or may not have used magic here and there, at the end of the day something built without an engineer’s oversight is much more likely to fall back down when it is needed most.

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: Carpenter’s tools, mason’s tools
Equipment: A bottle of black ink, a quill, a small knife, the blue prints to the last project you were working on, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

setters.set: Investigation, Nature, Carpenter's and Mason's tools

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Accomplishment. I love nothing more than the feeling of completing a project. (Neutral)
Innovation. Rules and assumptions get in the way of true innovation. (Chaotic)
Documentation. All knowledge should be codified so it can be applied to future projects. (Lawful)
Equality. Anything I make needs to benefit everyone, from the mightiest king to the lowliest peasant. (Good)
Glory. Lesser structures and people need to be relocated for my great works. (Evil)
Discovery. I travel to see the great works created by others and to inspire my own work. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I found part of an extremely complicated blueprint I could not decipher, I seek the other pages of this design.
I carry an antiquated set of tools to remind me of where I came from.
One day I want a building or structure named after me.
I studied at a prestigious institution.
Someone destroyed one of my prized creations and I will have my revenge.
I failed an important exam and lost my spot in the academy where I studied.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: IHAFE (I have acronyms for everything).
I will spend hours automating a task that would have taken minutes.
I scoff at and belittle what I consider less practical professions.
I won’t stop talking about the prestigious institution where I studied.
I require invigorating hot bean juice in order to get my best work done.
I explain everything in great detail at anyone who happens to be nearby.

element.name: Feature: Blueprints
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Craft and Creation

description.p: Given one day to plan, you can produce blueprints or schematics for bridges, siege equipment, buildings, dams, or any other common feat of engineering that anyone proficient with the necessary artisan tools could follow to craft the outlined construction given the time and resources. Buildings more fantastical in nature may still be within your grasp to plan with skill-appropriate ability checks at the GM’s discretion.
If you are using crafting, these blue prints can reduce the time and DC for engineering projects, reducing the crafting DC by your proficiency bonus for the construction project.

element.name: Tinker
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Craft and Creation

description.p: Falling somewhere between a merchant, a sage, and—if you ask some villagers—a vagabond, a Tinker wanders from town to town bringing a cart (or sometimes just a donkey) of knickknacks and knowhow. While not always welcomed with open arms, they can be a lifeline to the smallest and most widely flung towns, as no route is too odd and winding for them to wander. Tinkers may be wanderers by nature, but what opens doors is their useful knack for being able to fix problems with a dash of knowhow and ingenuity.

ul.li: Equipment: A set of tinker’s tools, a set of traveler’s clothes, a set of saddle bags, and a pack horse

setters.set: Insight, Nature, 1 Language, and Tinker's Tools

select.name: Ideal
select.item: A set of tinker’s tools, a set of traveler’s clothes, a set of saddle bags, and a pack horse
Overhaul. Everything in the world is made up of parts, I can use old parts to make new things. (Chaotic)
Maintenance. Everything needs a tune up now and then to keep it functioning as intended. (Lawful)
Upgrade. Just because something isn’t broken doesn’t mean it can’t be improved. (Good)
Greed. If I wait until a problem worsens, people will pay me more to fix it. (Evil)
Synergy. I do my job so others can keep doing theirs, like the gears of a clock. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: One of my creations backfired in front of a noble leaving me humiliated and disgraced.
A mentor trained me in tinkering to keep me out of trouble.
I once accidentally removed the screws... to a lock... to the town jail. The guards still view me as an accomplice.
The people of a distant town view me as family, and give me the warmest of welcomes.
I made an intricate mechanical creation... that wandered off in the night.
A wizard started offering magical solutions to mechanical problems, driving me out of business.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I can’t resist taking things apart to see how they work, I can mostly put them back together.
Stress testing is mandatory. Even things I don’t own. Even without permission.
Aesthetics are irrelevant to function.
I solve problems with a depth first methodology, often creating new problems.
I can never remember which pocket or pouch the item I am looking for is stored.
I’ll start attaching new “features” to anything around me that isn’t nailed down.

element.name: Feature: Know-how
element.source: Kibbles' Compendium of Craft and Creation

description.p: You’ve been around the block, and fixed more than one problem you had no business fixing with some application of ingenuity. When you need to construct or fix an item, you can often tinker up a replacement part from an alternate source. Any item that you could craft with Tinker’s Tools for less then 50gp pieces, you can craft for free with miscellaneousness knick knacks. At the GM’s discretion, this feature may help with larger crafting pieces as appropriate.
